definitions.definition: the movement every year of large numbers of birds or animals from one place to another

examples.text: the seasonal migration of blue whales

definitions.definition: the movement of people to a new country or area in order to find work or better living conditions

examples.text: migration from rural to urban areas
It was one of the largest **mass migrations** in US history.
**Net migration**— more people moving to the state than leaving—accounts for about two thirds of the population gain.
The decline of the rural economy has caused urban migration.
The rising level of poverty led to the migration of whole families to the capital and other big cities.
the great waves of migration that took Europeans to the New World

definitions.definition: the act of moving programs, etc. from one computer system to another; the fact of changing from one computer system to another
